title: PM says he will pause Brexit legislation after timetable loss – video
text:
Boris Johnson has confirmed he will set aside the bill that would implement his Brexit deal, despite the fact the Commons has backed it by 329 votes to 299, after his proposal to fast-track it through parliament was rejected by MPs.

MPs voted to reject the government’s timetable for the passage of the bill that would implement the prime minister’s Brexit deal. They voted against by 322 to 308; a majority of 14.

The prime minister said he does not want a delay and will continue to discuss with EU27 leaders until they decide whether or not to grant one
description: The prime minister said he does not want a delay and will continue to discuss with EU27 leaders until they decide whether or not to grant one
